intro: Scabiosa urceolata var. bipinnatisecta, commonly known as the double-serrated scabious, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its finely divided, bipinnatisect leaves that give it a feathery appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its delicate foliage and charming blooms make it a valuable addition to gardens seeking a touch of wild beauty.
